== Climate ==

Nouadhibou features a desert climate (BWh) under the Köppen climate classification. The city sees virtually no rainfall during the course of the year averaging a paltry 18 millimetres (0.71 in) of precipitation annually.  Despite the fact that it features a hot desert climate
column2: the area does not quite see the extreme temperatures that other areas with this climate feature because of strong maritime influences. The average annual temperature in the city is 21.7 °C (71 °F).

column1: == Transportation ==
=== Paved roads ===
Nouadhibou is linked with the Coastal Motorway RN2 to the capital Nouakchott (a distance of 450 km) and by highway to the Moroccan border in the north (a distance of 70 km).
=== Railway ===
Nouadhibou also is connected by railway to the iron mines in Zouérat
column2: 670 km to the east. The freight trains can be as long as 3 km
column3: reputedly the longest in the world. The railway also carries passengers and calls at Choum.

column1: === Aviation ===
The city is served by Nouadhibou Airport.

column1: == Health ==
The Nouadhibou Regional Hospital was opened in 2017 after a build time of five years and is the largest hospital in that region
